message.body: TagW
gl avoidance
I need to play like half the levels still
oh yeah I only did the first 3 also I think
lol
hi :)
progress though
isn't it just dying to the throwblock?
I wasn't paying attention either
lol
oh nevermind
I think you did see the shell without it registering yeah MingLee
throwblock hitbox is big so it hits below I guess
right yeah
keeping the throwblock is eassy
-s
but i dont want the player to do it, hence the filter
that thwomp really wants to stay alive
oh, and i thought by "progress" you meant "die to the GG"
wait what, i missed that
get frameruled
(you throw the throwblock a bit early though, i'd say)
you can delay your throw by like half a second i believe
"early, late, fuck"
- biob, 2024
gg!
nice
oh, did i miss it? belated ggs
idk i kind of like the level starting off on a somewhat rude blockgrab jump
hm, i'll consider nerfing it a bit
pause -> unpause to fix it
yes, the pause is changed so that it delays the music as little as possible; otherwise pausing in an actual level would totally break the sync
well the silence after the unpause is because pausing just cuts off all notes, so until the next sound is played, it's silent
for the pause itself: the sound effect is responsible for cutting off the music, so i just rewrote the sound effect
which is btw one of the most unpleasant coding experiences smw hacking has to offer
firstly, sound effect commands are completely written in hex. secondly, the syntax is extremely poorly documented. thirdly, its the spc.
oh you actually have runahead enabled now?
runahead is cringe
runahead is good
(but most of the time i still play on bizhawk with no runahead and extra large input delay just because lua script lmao)
oh no, that wasn't what i meant
i'm saying i tolerate the input delay because of the lua script
yeah I don't really have anything against it, just don't use it
runahead itself does desync for a bit on the last couple of jumpteam hacks though. not sure why
maybe that's a retroarch issue
i genuinely dont understand the appeal of retroarch
like you boot the hack up, and every time you do an input it'll roll back some crazy number of frames until it kind of fixes itself
I think it updates on every single input change? which is why it's so intensive. not very sure though
nono, it doesn't go through all inputs. it cannot possibly. modern cpus are not fast enough to run 2^12 instances of whatever emulator simulatenously
that makes sense
add a neural net to predict your 3 likely next button press combinations and emulate those Kapp
emulator lags if you're weird
yeah, but if this branch happens early in the frame, then you have to emulate most of the frame a lot of different times
oh are there actually 16 buttons
right cause there's a second byte for input
there are 16 data lines, but only 12 buttons on an actual controller
some control schemes (e.g. snes mouse?) use the other 4 data lines though
oh shit
despite having completed noise's fault, i already forgot the answer again
4th loop just started
let's just say: i ran into something after the last wednesday stream and had to restart the 11th loop
yes, ffmpeg just supports 10gb files
so no problems. except that the encoding process took a bit over 8 hours
yeah bizhawk can just run ffmpeg and gives you the option to set any custom flags you want
anyway, most of the processing power is actually spent on rescaling from 8:7 to 4:3. if i uploaded at 1280x1120, then the encode time is like half as long
i uploaded at 1440x1080, which is 4:3. it's not the upscaling that's terribly expensive, for some reason the expensive part is changing the aspect ratio
why not keep it 8:7
it's 8:7 with square pixels yeah
because smw looks better with non-square pixels
I'm so used to it that I think it's ok
I find 4:3 more awkward sometimes tbh. like the circular/square things get fat and stuff
widescreen smw
the emulator core outputs 256x224 pixels
how the emulator window then draws it is a different question
I just laugh at it
yeah the question of 4:3 vs 8:7 is mostly a stylistic one and there's no correct answer here, given that the snes doesn't operate in pixels to begin with
surely it despawns Kappa
especially since it's to the left yeah
it's left edge yeah. top left I assume
I remember struggling to keep one spawned when trying to lure it right from slightly offscreen so I think not
line-guided stuff does do that right. like from the left it has a massive safe region before despawning
when mario's on the left I guess I mean
i think there is a clear difficulty gap between this and the last level :)
yes, i mean the rightmost level
subversive awareness is easier than necrofantasia i would claim
but both of them are very hard
with practice, both of them should be fine. they have 12 and 16 cps respectively
its normal mode that you have to worry about
star ratings are only for normal mode
entering and seeing 1/16 was insane
why are you spinjumping into big boo in the first place though?
yeah, but it does make the landing far more precise
those eeries are my favorite part of the level
but i just really like this level in general
the camera is keeping mario 64 pixels from the left edge at all times
or is it 72?
oh yeah, sometimes the camera freezes of course
the constant left-right motion gets tiring after a while, so whenever possible i froze it for that
panicBasket ?
seems that way
give it a moment
back
panicBasket again
hm
give it 2
hm, it hasn't been this unstable for this long in a while not sure what's up with that
back?
looks semistable at least
that eerie section is very hard to learn imo, so i put an extra cp in the middle
im a bit surprised the stairs took you this long, that cp is actually also quite short
lma
o
i actually considered splitting up cp1 as well and i only didnt because i didnt find a good place to put it without messing up all the sprite spawns there
noise's fault update: 6th loop has started
no, you have 3 hours 40 minutes
5 loops done, 6 to go
that's an actual question
what actually happens in noise's fault anyway. I haven't seen it. or should i just wait for the extremely long video

well the tl;dr is: there's a slow autoscroller in a vertical level. it scrolls past the screen boundaries, and thus there's no more collision. however, the graphics loop, which is why it looks a bit janky.
dacin used that in the final luigi room of armageddon too right
yes, he did
now after the slow autoscroller has scrolled 65536 pixels (which takes 36 minutes), we return to the playable area again. in noise's fault, we collect a key and go onto our merry way
okay that's funny
the final obstacle requires positioning 11 keys pixel perfectly, and now the question that i won't spoil here is how to set that up.
I did see mention of 11 keys, so that makes sense
inb4 it actually isnt the intended solution and there's an alt strat Kapp
actually there's one thing about the level that neither dacin nor me understands and that you haven't even seen yet
(maybe i misunderstood dacin, but i dont understand it for sure)
i wont say anything, but it affects gameplay
he found the correct gap!
no, you still have 23 minutes
it's okay if it breaks a rule you can just add the misc:troll tag
joke hacks have precedent and it sounds like it's done with a lot of careful intent so there's really no reason to reject it I think
did i miss some moderation discussion?
oh sure. the casual viewer might think that 6+ hours of straight flying is stupid (and to an extent, i agree), but there's some actual planning you need to do
like as stupid as the hack is, it has merit
and it doesn't go out of its way to make the repetitive parts annoying
lmao
yeah if it did that i would've rejected immediately lmao
btw i really like the second descending stairs of this cp
it totally looks like you're allowed to land on the straight part but you just aren't
still 10 minutes to go until it loops
you know, it would've been very funny had i just uploaded a video of noise's fault that loops 11 times but ultimately fails to complete the hack
yeah, exactly. waiting a full year is too much. too likely that somebody else gets a clear and then the joke is dead
the 7th loop started while you were gone
it's 2^17 frames, so not exactly a super weird unit
yes
nono, that would be much too fast
such hectic gameplay is not tolerated
idk what happened there
smw happened i suppose
gg
they just lock the vertical camera
so that you fall offscreen faster
dirt? that's a cobweb
well of course it does
i mean i guess i could've made it "a tileset-specific tile" instead, but then i'd rather have it be dirt
well, all of the levels are "doable"
ok sure
actually, which levels have you beaten in normal mode so far?
this one seemed hard
not that hard but I didn't feel very confident in doing it lol
i find it funny that you're contemplating the ghost house but haven't beaten the second level
just like simple bounces
i might nerf the cape part in this tbh
lol
definitely still harder than the first one
seems so yeah
hm, suggestion accepted, but i'll have to rewrite a bit of code for that
well as it currently stands, i dont think the percentage is ever stored outside of scratch ram
anyway, i'll put it on the list of things to consider
there's also the option of just permanently having a percentage counter somewhere during gameplay
pb is currently not even tracked
although tracking it is easy
numbers fan
time to add current percentage, attempt counter, pb percentage and whatever to the pause screen
more data
lol
what's the question?
oh huh yeah I wonder why it looks weird in that
no, its a percent sign
is it just the bg
its just that the bg cloud has the same color as the interior of the percent sign
it's so hard to tell though yeah lol
time to change the bg
tree layer
the vanilla title screen frame counts as trees in my head
that was hilarious
especially because there was no need to capespin at all
yeah, that pipe could be shortened by 1 block
it works by not capespinning
there you go :)
it might be that it works with capespinning, but not capespinning gives you more height
wait, actually it doesnt what am i saying
this is not how smw works im sorry
capespinning doesnt matter at all, ignore me
ok, there is a situation in which it matters, but it shouldn't matter here, because you dont have big air when bouncing off the koopa
I think face direction does matter for maximum height, because you get best height in phase 3 (the neutral one, I think it's 3) while moving forward
but yeah you should just face forward and let go of dpad. hold b for tiny boost
isnt that only when you have an aircatch stored?
no
i guess then i dont understand cape
if you have an air catch stored it'll expend it I think? like frame 1, and then it won't even look very distinct
but yeah not necessary for a really big bounce. honestly no clue why though yeah
that's the strat
let's go
lmao
fyi, loop #9 just started
I guess holding b helps
I think just holding back, and jump for the little extra is enough
holding b when bouncing on enemies makes you bounce higher :)
from what I remember thinking when playing
it like slightly applies
it applies
you gain maybe like 1.5 tiles on a high bounce
its just that cape caps your upwards speed at -56, so you only get 1 frame of the sweet -88. but then you're still at -56 instead of -48.
the sweet -88
now I'm finally gonna remember what initial high bounce speed is
i might just remove the spiny
lol
well it does force you to turn around, and the turnaround after that is a problem for you it seems
you keep canceling your pumps at -20 upwards speed by capespinning too early
hi again :) , did i miss anything?
11th loop is coming up in 2 minutes
you still have 33 minutes until noise's fault ends
well, still thanks for playing it. it gives me things to consider changing
because that spiny sure seems to give you trouble
oof
btw, noise's fault is over
oh yeah, i guess that's a bad time to stop
you can do this
yeah i know that feeling
oh you really dont know what happens in cp7?
you can also also just double-tap X into the spiny to begin with
you could've saved it by going for takeoff meter abuse i believe
or by mashing right to get big air quicker
its free with the ~correct strat~
well if you go into practice, you'll find the ~correct strat~ quickly i claim
sure
go ahead, be stubborn, die at 98% Kapp
(pls dont)
